channel.title: Wash Documentation on home
channel.description: Recent content in Wash Documentation on home

item.title: Core Plugins
item.description: Working on core plugins The plugin package defines a set of interfaces that a plugin can implement to enable specific behaviors. - Parent can list its children and is presented as a directory in the Wash filesystem. - Readable can retrieve the entire contents of a file and makes it available to read via standard system calls to the filesystem. - Streamable can provide a stream of updates on an entry.

item.title: External Plugins
item.description: Plugin Script init list read metadata stream exec schema Errors Aside (optional) Bash Example External plugins let Wash talk to other things outside of the built-in plugins. They can be written in any language. To write an external plugin, you need to do the following: Write the plugin script. This is the script that Wash will shell out to whenever it needs to invoke a method on a specific entry within your plugin.
